result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric S Harvey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. - last 90 days on electronic monitor, if eligible - Stayed
Concurrent with: concurrent with 15CM318, but consecutive to any other sentence.
Concurrent with: with currently serving probation

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
No contact with Walmart in Plover.

Comply with any assessments and counseling as recommended by Agent.
No restitution requested.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric S Harvey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: letter from DOC dated 12/01/16 in re:  request for clarification of DNA Surcharge with response letter from Judge Eagon dated 12/06/16

8:57 a.m. Defendant Eric S Harvey in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases: 15CM275 and 15CM318
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Probation w/conditions for each case.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Guilty for both cases 15CM275 and 15CM318

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CM275 and 15CM318.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. No credit.
Atty Halverson concurs with joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT:*****PROBATION***
15CM275:  I/S Sentence: 180 days jail, concurrent to each other, but consecutive to any other sentence with Huber - last 90 days on electronic monitor, if eligible - Stayed:
18 mo Probation, concurrent with current serving probation.
Conditions:
Pay costs.
No contact with Walmart in Plover.
Comply with any assessments and counseling as recommended by Agent.
No restitution requested.

15CM318:  I/S Sentence: 180 days jail, concurrent with 15CM275,  but consecutive to any other sentence with Huber - last 90 days on electronic monitor, if eligible - Stayed:
18 mo Probation, concurrent with 15CM275
Compy with same conditions as stated in 15CM275.
Pay costs
$1,000 sig bond: No contact with Walmart in Plover.

Defendant Eric S Harvey in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
BTC: $1,000 sig bond: No contact with Walmart in Plover.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
